channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Green and yellow lights out, 16th March
item.description:
The light on the centre of the roundabout which faces towards the A40 eastbound traffic has the green and yellow lights out, this has been broken since December and means the first car often does not realise the lights have gone green because they cannot see any of the other lights on the road/roundabout.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bollard damaged - Timbercombe Lane, 16th March
item.description:
Bollard at junction of Timbercombe Lane and Cirencester Rd has been knocked over
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Forden House Timbercombe Lane, Charlton Kings

item.title: Cycle route sign damaged - Cirencester Rd, 16th March
item.description:

item.title: Potholes in road, 16th March
item.description:
Several potholes in road along with sunken/raised ironworks. Within a few yards of those recently sprayed (for potential repair?).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Water Hatch Silk Mill Lane, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking on zigzags and in disabled bah, 16th March
item.description:
This morning 16/03 there were 6 cars parked on the keep clear zigzags outside Innsworth Infant School on Luke Lane. There were also 2 cars across the disable bay neither displayed blue badges. This happens every school drop off 9am and pick up 3pm. The school do nothing to discourage it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Pumping Station Luke Lane, Innsworth
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface is a disgraceful state, 15th March
item.description:
The whole section from the Hatherley Manor hotel to the A38 is very dangerous, the road surface has broken up very badly. A cyclist could easily fall off their bike and get injured and there must be numerous coil springs and burst tyres happening.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Lodge Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley
Report on FixMyStreet
